Sentencas: This paper develops a relatively simple model that is intended to rapidly evaluate design configuration and operating conditions for tubular anode-supported solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) stacks.
Titulo: Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks

Sentencas: Heat is removed from the SOFC tubes by a combination of convection and radiation.
Titulo: Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks

Sentencas: Heat is convected to air that circulates outside the SOFC tubes and radiated to a surrounding cylindrical wall.
Titulo: Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks

Sentencas: The tubes are assumed to be arranged in hexagonal arrays in which the distance between tubes centers form equilateral triangles.
Titulo: Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks

Sentencas: The paper presents new configuration-factor formulas that are needed to represent arrays of staggered cylinders.
Titulo: Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks

Sentencas: The configuration factors are derived for long cylinders using the crossed-string method.
Titulo: Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks

Sentencas: These configuration factors have general utility beyond the application to fuel-cell systems.
Titulo: Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks

Sentencas: The model is applied to a particular cell and stack system and used to evaluate the effects of a range of design and operating conditions.
Titulo: Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks
Radiative and convective heat transport within tubular solid-oxide fuel-cell stacks
